Articles.Content: Are there any working at the moment? can't stand mucking about with the standard parts
+1, pain to build ssto with stock wing, only 2 big delta wings or hundred liitle freezing wings...
B9 procedural wings, if you look the update isn't official but in the OP he links to a working version.

B9 procedural wings, if you look the update isn't official but in the OP he links to a working version.

But B9 works only with FAR, on stock untested and unsupported ?

But B9 works only with FAR, on stock untested and unsupported ?

Incorrect.
Thanks for info. Was looking for something like that since Procedural Dynamics pWings are not yet updated to 1.0.2.
I should warn FAR users, procedural B9 wings used in symmetry will create less voxels in one wing, causing asymmetric lift and possible deaths of poor expendable kerbals

I should warn FAR users, procedural B9 wings used in symmetry will create less voxels in one wing, causing asymmetric lift and possible deaths of poor expendable kerbals

There's two ways not to get that effect...

Latest dev version of FAR on Github has resolved the issue. Anyone using the latest FAR builds no longer needs to be using the hack that I linked a few posts up to make this work with the release version.

To be perfectly clear:

Using FAR 15.2 "Ferri" Release

  • Install Bac9's files from the OP
  • Download the patch from this link

Using FAR 15.dev or Stock

  • Install Bac9's files from the OP
  • Install the latest package from my signature
